message:
Yesterday we were talking about image compression for front-end optimization. Today I found this study by Mozilla for better alternatives for JPG

http://people.mozilla.org/~josh/lossy_compressed_image_study_october_2013/
name: Lossy Compressed Image Formats Study (October 2013)
caption: people.mozilla.org
description: This study compares the compression performance of four different image formats: JPEG, JPEG XR, WebP, and HEVC-MSP. The latter three formats were chosen because they are frequently discussed as possible JPEG successors.
